name: Medieval Magic and Its Origins Quiz  | 10 Questions

questions.text: The earliest book of Magic during the Middle Ages was authored by Rabanus Maurus. What was this book called?
questions.explanation:
De Magicus Artibus.

	Magic was a word derived from Magos - which is a Greek derivation of a Persian term. Magos is a Persian term for a priest. There were 3 primary tests derived in the Medieval era, which in large part derived from Isidore's "Etymologies".

questions.text: St. Augustine mentions the Dark Arts in the Bible. Where was the witch from that conjured up Samuel for King Saul?

Hincmar of Rheims spoke of "syrix-es"- demons that devoured babies during the Middle Ages, replacing the baby with a straw doll while carrying off the child in his talons- actually, these references were made earlier by a Roman writer. Who was he?
Who was the Saint who believed the cross would frighten away the demons?
questions.explanation:
Athanasius.

	Demons were thought to control storms, disease and every mishap that occurred during the Middle Ages.

questions.text: During the Middle Ages, many of the Magical incantations were  derived from what legendary Persian poet?
questions.explanation:
Zoroaster & Zarathustra.

	The "Theodosian Code" and the "Brevarium" were from Alaric the Visigoth. But all of them really were copied from Zoroaster and Hippocrates.

questions.text: Divination and auguries made up the essence of magic in the Middle Ages. What was not one of the 3 types of magic practiced?
questions.explanation:
cluniastes.

	Aruspicinam is soothsaying employing animal entrails, fulguritiam is divination through thunder, and oscitanes is divination from bird calls.

questions.text: Who was the religious writer/saint in the Middle Ages, who countermanded the scientific explanations found in "De natura Rerum" -  a logical explanation for the causes of diseases?
questions.explanation:
Augustine & St. Augustine & Saint Augustine

	St. Augustine's belief in demons was the primary force for the widespread practice of witchcraft.

questions.text: The magical practice of drinking blood comes down from Procopius, in his "History of Wars". Which group of people are described as having originating this practice?
Who was the famous Magus described in Acts 8:9-24, who seduced the people of Samaria?
questions.explanation:
Simon.

	Simon was said to make inanimate objects take on life and move, fly in the air, age younger or older, and change sex as well.  I wonder if he ever was human, since he did not age.

questions.text: Who was the former Bishop described by Paul the Deacon, possessing magical powers similar to those of Ham?
questions.explanation:
Theophilus.

	Theophilus was a good Bishop, but his frustration led him astray to the Dark Arts.
